abstractContent.text: of the talk Beyond literal meaning, words have associations with sentiment, emotion, colour, and even music.

Identifying such associations is of substantial benefit for information visualization, data sonifica-tion, and sentiment analysis, which in turn have applications in commerce, education, art, and health.
I will present methods to generate high-coverage resources that capture such associations.
I will show how these resources can be used for analyzing emotions in text, detecting personality from essays, and generating music from novels.
Finally, I will show how word-sentiment association lexicons have helped create the top-ranking systems in recent SemEval competitions on the sentiment analysis of social media posts.
